title: (x) Greek-looking "Extasia" and ornaments - hand drawn {Yves}
content:
Your expertise will be appreciated.

Also attaching a design ... could this be a dingbat type design-font?

Thanks!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [ID.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20090420135304/http:/typophile.com/files/ID.gif) | 6.88 KB |
| [ID2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20090420135304/http:/typophile.com/files/ID2.gif) | 4.09 KB |
author: link

comments.content:
The two A’s in Extasia are different, so i guess this must be hand drawn/custom designed. There are a number of Greek-looking fonts available that look a bit like your sample.

Dunno about the ornaments/dingbats.

You have an incredibly discerning eye ... two of them ;)  
Thanks!

There are several “Greek” fonts at Dafont

[http://www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=204&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=10&text=EXT...](http://web.archive.org/web/20090420135304/http:/www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=204&page=1&nb_ppp_old=10&text=EXTASIA&nb_ppp=50&classt=alpha "http://www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=204&page=1&nb\_ppp\_old=10&text=EXTASIA&nb\_ppp=50&classt=alpha")
